III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
1

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents'
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility did not follow established policy & procedure regarding
intakes of transgender youth.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed over the phone on 12/18/2024
and had no additional information to provide.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on
12/18/2024. She stated she was a former administration staff for
the facility. Supervisor 1 recalled not having direct involvement in
the admissions process during her time working at the
facility. Supervisor 1 related concerns she had heard second
hand, that Staff 1 had been instructed by the Chief Administrator
to deny placement of youth in the program with their sexual
identity as a consideration. Supervisor 1 expressed concern this
was related to one specific youth who had been placed within the
facility and was under consideration to change placements to the
organization’s independent living program. Supervisor 1 could not
provide any other details on her concerns.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 02/25/2024. Staff 1
confirmed her involvement in the admission processes for the
facility. She denied ever having the sexual identity of a youth play
a role in whether they were admitted to the program or not. Staff
1 also denied ever being instructed to do so. She stated there
were factors such as behavioral or cognitive needs that may have
been a factor in deciding whether a youth should be placed within
the facility. Staff 1 referenced one specific youth who had been
placed in the program. This youth was born a biological male and
identified as female. Staff 1 referred to this youth’s success in the
program and her involvement in the placement consideration of
that youth to the organization’s independent living program.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed over the phone on
02/25/2024. She confirmed her current employment with the
facility and involvement in past admissions processes at the
facility. Supervisor 2 denied ever being involved in the denial of a
placement of a youth because of their gender identity. She also
denied ever being told or pressured to do so. Supervisor 2
recalled receiving placement information for youth during the
2

admissions process as well as interviewing youth. She stated the
facility may have been aware of the gender identity of a youth
during that process, but that information would have only been
used to find their best fit and begin treatment planning for them.
Chief Administrator was interviewed over the phone on
02/25/2024. She confirmed her involvement in the admissions
process for past placements at the facility. Chief Administrator
denied ever considering the gender identity of youth as a reason
for the denial of placement. She also denied ever instructing any
staff to do the same. Chief Administrator believed the program
had success in supporting youth placed that had varied gender
identities. She was aware of one specific youth that had been
placed in the program that was recently considered for placement
in the organization’s independent living program, but clarified that
this placement consideration was for a possible transition from the
child caring institution to the organization’s independent living
program.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed over the phone on
02/26/2024. She confirmed she was no longer employed with the
facility. In her past employment at the facility Supervisor 3 was a
part of the admissions process for possible new
placements. Supervisor 3 did not believe there were ever any
situations where a youth’s gender identity or sexuality was a
consideration in their acceptance to the facility. She denied ever
being told to make that a consideration for a possible placement of
a youth.
Documentation reviewed:
• The facility’s program statement for each of the three
specialized units was provided and reviewed. Jacob Hall
was a behavioral stabilization program designed
specifically for males. Hope Hall was a behavioral
stabilization program designed specifically for
females. Matthew Hall was a problematic sexual behaviors
program designed specifically for males. There was no
narrative within the program statements that refer to the
consideration of sexuality or gender identity as a part of
admissions criteria for youth in any of the programs.
• Documentation from the facility’s legal representation of the
Board of Directors dated 10/24/2024 was provided and
reviewed. A letter from legal representation of the board
was provided to facility staff that stated the organization
would “provide services to gay and transgender people on
the same basis as it would to ever other person.” The letter
3

also stated the organization would not “engage in any
activity which promotes lifestyles that it believed are
damaging to human dignity.”
• Additional documentation consisting of letters from staff
directed to the Board of Directors were provided. These
detailed organization staff members' responses to this
letter, largely supporting the organization’s services to the
LGBTQIA+ community.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff interviews and
documentation reviewed the facility did not have any
discriminatory practices within the consideration of new
placements within the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
